2. Long-Term Contracts: The local government ensures that affordable homes are leasehold and have long-term contracts. This ensures that the rent will remain affordable and helps to prevent landlords from charging excessive rent in the future.

3. Quality Standards: The local government has set quality standards for affordable housing to ensure that they meet a minimum standard. This includes regulations around insulation, heating, and general living standards. The quality standards ensure that affordable homes remain habitable and meet basic needs.

4. Monitoring and Enforcement: The local government monitors the provision of affordable housing to ensure that landlords comply with the regulations. This helps to prevent landlords from charging excessive rent and ensures that affordable homes remain available for lower-income earners.

Overall, while there have been concerns raised, the local government in Hull has put measures in place to ensure that affordable homes remain affordable in the long term.
